critique: This document designates the District of Columbia Police and Firefighters' Retirement and Disability System as a covered retirement system for federal employees under a specific law. It also designates the Secretary of the Treasury as the appropriate agency head. There's no immediately obvious ideological tilt, immigration stance, expansion of executive power, or impact on national security vs. civil liberties. It seems to have a slight federalism aspect as it relates to the District of Columbia, but it's not a strong shift. It also doesn't seem to have a direct impact on economic regulation or social inclusion.
